contentrichtext.text: {{notability|Music|date=July 2012}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Danilo Soruco Arancibia''' (6 July 1927 in [[Tarija, Bolivia|Tarija]], [[Bolivia]] – 1 April 2004 in Tarija, Bolivia) was a Bolivian [[singer-songwriter]]. Soruco wrote more than 300 songs. A [[Communism|communist]], he was banned under the Bolivian leadership of the 1970s. Soruco was in exile in [[Caracas, Venezuela]] until 1978. Among his tunes are "La vida es linda", "Ya la pagarán", “Duraznero”, “Instantánea”, and particularly "Caraqueña", composed in his [[Venezuela]]n exile, which are sung at Bolivia's popular celebrations. {{Citation needed|date=April 2008}} Soruco won Bolivia's National Culture Prize in 2003. Discography: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Album ! Song !
